title: Volkswagen Arena - Wikipedia
snippet: Volkswagen Arena (German pronunciation: [ˈfɔlksvaːɡn̩ ʔaˌʁeːnaː]; also known as the VfL Wolfsburg Arena due to UEFA sponsorship regulations) is a football stadium in the German city of Wolfsburg, Lower Saxony. It was opened in 2002 and named after the automotive group Volkswagen AG.

title: Stadium | Volkswagen Arena and AOK Stadion | VfL Wolfsburg
snippet: Due to its central location, the Volkswagen Arena and adjacent AOK Stadion - home to the VfL Ladies as well as the men’s Under-19 team since early 2015 - are within easy walking distance of Wolfsburg Hauptbahnhof train station and the city’s central bus station.

title: Volkswagen Arena – StadiumDB.com
snippet: Stadium: Volkswagen Arena, Wolfsburg, Germany, capacity: 30000, club: VfL Wolfsburg.

title: Wolfsburg confirmed as EURO venue | VfL Wolfsburg
snippet: There’s great delight in Wolfsburg as Germany has been confirmed as the host country for UEFA Women’s EURO 2029 – and Wolfsburg’s Volkswagen Arena will be one of the eight official venues of the tournament.

title: VfL Wolfsburg
snippet: The Volkswagen Arena and the neighbouring AOK Stadium are the teams' home venues. Equipped with state-of-the-art technology, the Volkswagen Arena offers a top-class football experience with 29,000 seats.
